results.title: Boy to man
results.brief_description: Indicates the changes in a boy’s body at adolescence in growth, skin, and voice , and illustrates by diagrams the male and female reproductive organs.

results.title: Boy of Southeast Asia
results.brief_description: Presents Geng, the young son in a typical home and his brother going to school. Shows the countryside of Southeast Asia, its ancient temples, girls fishing in rivers and river boats carrying cargo and passengers. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: Boy meets band
results.creator_credit: Tim Wilson, ONF | NFB, David Bennett and Nicholas Balla
results.brief_description: They are only pint-size musicians but they make peppy music. The West Vancouver Boys’ Band (there are girls in it too), prizewinners at band festivals in Canada and Europe, set feet tapping in this film as they rehearse for a local gala event. Follows a new recruit, to show the full scope of musical opportunity given to youngsters in Vancouver through joint community effort.

results.title: Boy in the garden
results.brief_description: The enchantment to be found in a bush-like garden by a young boy who reflects the spirit shown in the statue of Pan playing his pipes. Scampering, dabbling his toes, floating flower petals and pressing his face close to the flowers, he shows us his fascination in the wonder of nature. A film without commentary and with flute accompaniment. Music: Nancy Tow.

results.title: Boy and a boa
results.creator_credit: Lora Hays, Boa Films and Renata Stoia
results.brief_description: The story of Martin and his pet boa is informative and entertaining. A story of a young boy and his pet boa. The boa gets loose in a library and gives the viewer a snake’s-eye view of the facilities. We are also learning a great deal about snakes and other members of the reptile family.

results.title: Boxing for boys: attack, defence and ringcraft
results.creator_credit: Frank Wells, Gaumont-British Instructional and Colin Bell
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the chief form of attack and defence; section of the glove to be used in hitting, portion of the body to be hit; correct stance; the straight left; the right hook; the swing; a lead and an uppercut; side stepping; the cross counter; the parry, blocking; slipping and ducking.
